sentences.en: A dark red stain was spreading across his shirt.
sentences.cn: 一块深红色的污渍正在他的衬衫上渗开。

sentences.en: Be careful you don’t stain the carpet.
sentences.cn: 当心别把地毯弄脏了。

sentences.en: Cold water should take that stain out of your skirt.
sentences.cn: 用凉水可洗去你裙子上的污迹.

sentences.en: Does this material stain easily?
sentences.cn: 这种料子容易染色 吗 ?

sentences.en: Her fingers were stained yellow from years of smoking.
sentences.cn: 她的手指因长年吸烟被熏黄了。

sentences.en: It was widely used by cytologists to stain chromosomes.
sentences.cn: 它被细胞学家广泛地用来着色染色体.

sentences.en: Remove stains by soaking in a mild solution of bleach.
sentences.cn: 用温和的漂白溶液浸泡以去除污渍。

sentences.en: She couldn't rub off the blood stain on her blouse.
sentences.cn: 她没法将上衣的血渍擦掉.

sentences.en: She scrubbed the stain on the floor.
sentences.cn: 她把地板上的污迹擦掉了.

sentences.en: Some foods can stain the teeth, as of course can smoking.
sentences.cn: 某些食物会在牙齿上留下污渍，吸烟当然也会。

sentences.en: Stain the table before you varnish it.
sentences.cn: 先给桌子着色,然后才能上清漆.

sentences.en: The damp rising from the ground caused the walls to stain badly.
sentences.cn: 地面上升起的湿气使墙壁的颜色变得很难看.

sentences.en: The stain will have to be sanded out.
sentences.cn: 这斑点必须用砂纸磨掉.

sentences.en: This ink stain won't rub out.
sentences.cn: 这墨水渍擦不掉.

sentences.en: This tablecloth stains very easily.
sentences.cn: 这块桌布很容易脏。

sentences.en: We painted the wooden floor with a white stain.
sentences.cn: 我们把木地板刷成了白色。

sentences.en: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.cn: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

sentences.en: White clothes stain easily.
sentences.cn: 白衣服容易弄脏.

sentences.en: White clothes stain quickly.
sentences.cn: 白色衣服会很快弄脏.

sentences.en: You can stain the wood with this special liquid to give it a pleasing color.
sentences.cn: 你可以用这特制的液体染这块木料,使之看起来赏心悦目.

words.tran_cn: 不锈的；纯洁的，未被玷污的；无瑕疵的
玷污；败坏；给…染色（stain的过去式和过去分词）
污点；瑕疵；[试剂][生物]着色剂

trans.tran_en: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

trans.tran_cn: 染料，着色剂，污点，沾污处
trans.tran_en: to accidentally make a mark on something, especially one that cannot be removed, or to be marked in this way
to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid

trans.tran_cn: 玷污，染污，败坏（名声），给…染色
trans.tran_en: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
